column1: Maldegem (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈmɑldəɣɛm]) (West Flemish: Moaldegem) is a municipality located in the Belgian province of East Flanders. The municipality comprises the villages of Maldegem
column2: Adegem and Middelburg. Kleit and Donk have always been separate hamlets of Maldegem. On January 1
column4: Maldegem had a total population of 22
column5: 289. The total area is 94.64 square kilometres (36.54 sq mi) which gives a population density of 236 inhabitants per km².
